prompt:
Patient: 79 M
Indication: Stent evaluation
Findings: Stent in Right Mainstem (migrated slightly distally but patent)
Intervention: Electrocautery ablation of Right Mainstem and Bronchus Intermedius
Outcome: Patency 70% -> 95%
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 02/11/2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Weiss

INDICATION FOR OPERATION Male is a 79-year-old male who presents with a lung mass and for bronchoscopy for stent evaluation.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Endobronchial obstruction (Right Mainstem and Bronchus Intermedius) 

PROCEDURE

Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscopy 

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode) 

Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (Electrocautery) 

ATTENDING Dr. Gupta

ASSISTANT Dr. Lee

SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Electrocautery system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Patient Position: Supine 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

Stent in Right Mainstem in migrated slightly distally but patent.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea and bilateral mainstems from mucus.

Endobronchial Obstruction / Electrocautery Ablation Endobronchial obstruction at the Right Mainstem and Bronchus Intermedius was treated with the following modalities:

Modality: Electrocautery

Tool: blunt probe

Setting: Effect 30W

Result: Ablated

Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 70% patent.

After treatment, the airway was 95% patent.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S) None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Male is a 79-year-old male who presented for stent evaluation; Right Mainstem stent noted in migrated slightly distally but patent.

Mucus successfully aspirated from Trachea and bilateral mainstems.

Obstruction in Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius treated with Electrocautery;

patency improved from 70% to 95%.

Repeat bronchoscopy in 2-3 months.

Follow-up in clinic with no further intervention planned.

prompt: Please generate a procedure note for a 55 year old female patient referred by Dr. Ingraham. We checked the stent in the Trachea which was patent with mild granulation tissue at proximal edge. We treated obstruction in the Right Mainstem and Bronchus Intermedius using Electrocautery which improved patency from 70 percent to 95 percent. Also suctioned the Trachea and bilateral mainstems.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

Stent in Trachea in patent with mild granulation tissue at proximal edge.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea and bilateral mainstems from mucus.

Endobronchial Obstruction / Electrocautery Ablation Endobronchial obstruction at the Right Mainstem and Bronchus Intermedius was treated with the following modalities:

Modality: Electrocautery

Tool: blunt probe

Setting: Effect 30W

Result: Ablated

Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 70% patent.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Female is a 55-year-old female who presented for stent evaluation; Trachea stent noted in patent with mild granulation tissue at proximal edge.

Mucus successfully aspirated from Trachea and bilateral mainstems.

Obstruction in Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius treated with Electrocautery;

patency improved from 70% to 95%.

Repeat bronchoscopy in 1 month.

Follow-up in clinic with referral to radiation oncology.

prompt: IP bronch note. 55 F. Stent eval Left Mainstem. APC used for obs in Trachea (Mid 1/3) and Left Mainstem. improved 80 to 100. Dr. Jacobs assisted. f/u 2-3 months.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 03/19/2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Smith

INDICATION FOR OPERATION Female is a 55-year-old female who presents with a lung mass and for bronchoscopy for stent evaluation.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Endobronchial obstruction (Trachea (Mid 1/3) and Left Mainstem) 

PROCEDURE

Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscopy 

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode) 

Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) 

ATTENDING Dr. Gupta

ASSISTANT Dr. Jacobs

SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Patient Position: Supine 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

Stent in Left Mainstem in patent with no obstruction.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea and bilateral mainstems from mucus.

Endobronchial Obstruction / APC Ablation Endobronchial obstruction at the Trachea (Mid 1/3) and Left Mainstem was treated with the following modalities:

Modality: APC

Tool: 2.3 mm straight probe

Setting: Pulse effect 3

Result: Ablated

Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 80% patent.

After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S) None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Female is a 55-year-old female who presented for stent evaluation; Left Mainstem stent noted in patent with no obstruction.

Mucus successfully aspirated from Trachea and bilateral mainstems.

Obstruction in Trachea (Mid 1/3), Left Mainstem treated with APC;

patency improved from 80% to 100%.

Repeat bronchoscopy in 2-3 months.

Follow-up in clinic with consideration for cryotherapy.

prompt: Please generate a procedure note for a 79 year old female patient referred by Dr. Patel. We checked the stent in the Right Mainstem which was migrated slightly distally but patent. We treated obstruction in the Trachea (Distal 1/3), Right Mainstem, and Left Mainstem using APC which improved patency from 90 percent to 100 percent. Also suctioned the RMS, BI, and LMS.

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 05/12/2025 CC Referred Physician: Dr. Ingraham

INDICATION FOR OPERATION Female is a 55-year-old female who presents with a lung mass and for bronchoscopy for stent evaluation.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure. Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Endobronchial obstruction (Trachea and Carina) 

PROCEDURE

Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscopy 

Therapeutic aspiration (initial episode) 

Destruction of tumor OR relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) 

ATTENDING Dr. Kim

ASSISTANT Dr. Thompson

SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Patient Position: Supine 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

Stent in RML orifice in good position.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the RUL and RML segments from mucus.

Endobronchial Obstruction / APC Ablation Endobronchial obstruction at the Trachea and Carina was treated with the following modalities:

Modality: APC

Tool: Side-fire probe

Setting: Pulse effect 5

Result: Ablated

Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 85% patent.

After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S) None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Female is a 55-year-old female who presented for stent evaluation; RML orifice stent noted in good position.

Mucus successfully aspirated from RUL and RML segments.

Obstruction in Trachea, Carina treated with APC;

patency improved from 85% to 100%.

Repeat bronchoscopy in 2 weeks.

Follow-up in clinic with consideration for cryotherapy.

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and BP were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer that was present throughout the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC system.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Patient Position: Supine 

Initial Airway Inspection Findings:

Stent in Left Mainstem in patent with no obstruction.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Trachea and bilateral mainstems from mucus.

Endobronchial Obstruction / APC Ablation Endobronchial obstruction at the Trachea (Mid 1/3) and Left Mainstem was treated with the following modalities:

Modality: APC

Tool: 2.3 mm straight probe

Setting: Pulse effect 3

Result: Ablated

Prior to treatment, affected airway was noted to be 80% patent.

After treatment, the airway was 100% patent.

Conclusion The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S) None 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

Male is a 62-year-old male who presented for stent evaluation; Left Mainstem stent noted in patent with no obstruction.

Mucus successfully aspirated from Trachea and bilateral mainstems.

Obstruction in Trachea (Mid 1/3), Left Mainstem treated with APC;

patency improved from 80% to 100%.

Repeat bronchoscopy in 1 month.

Follow-up in clinic with referral to radiation oncology.
